name: magica
description: ImageMagick for browser and Node.js, easy setup, high level API and Command Line Interface, including WASM binary for an easy setup.

scripts.test: npm run build && npx ava --serial && npm run test-browser
scripts.test-js: exit 0; npm run build && npx ava ./dist/test/*Test.js --serial
scripts.test-worker: npm run build && cp dist/src/imageMagick/compiled/magick.wasm dist && parcel serve test-browser/webWorker/index.html
scripts.build-node-magick: cat src/imageMagick/magickPrefix.js > src/imageMagick/compiled/nodeMagick.js && echo '' >> src/imageMagick/compiled/nodeMagick.js && cat src/imageMagick/compiled/magick.js >> src/imageMagick/compiled/nodeMagick.js
scripts.browser-sample: rm -rf dist && mkdir -p dist && npm run build && cp dist/src/imageMagick/compiled/magick.wasm dist && parcel serve test-browser/testBrowser.html
scripts.build: npm run build-node-magick && npm run clean && npx tsc && npm run copy
scripts.lint: npm run organizeImports && npm run format
scripts.docs: npm run docs-readme-toc && npm run docs-api
scripts.docs-api: rm -rf docs && typedoc  --ignoreCompilerErrors --theme markdown --out docs --readme none --excludeNotExported src/index.ts
scripts.all: npm run clean && npm run lint && npm run build && npm run test && npm run test-js && npm run docs
scripts.all-publish: npm run all && git commit -a -m 'version patch' && npm version patch && npm publish
